Description: Rim sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: narrow reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centres; exterior: short diagonal strokes between pairs of bands; below on right, part of undetermined motif in red.
Curator's comments: The type of rim decoration on the sherd is also seen on Grand Style chalices. For parallels, see Cambridge Fitzwilliam Museum GR.79.1894 and British Museum 1888,0601.502.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 290, no. 882)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1119) (phase 2)
